Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the chests of people in hot lands, such as in Al-Andalus in the land of Arabs and in the hot and dry lands of India with little moisture, where there is no grass or tree. 
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And often it is generated in other parts of the body besides the thighs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the gestation of it is putrefaction that comes from the chain, just as serpents and worms and weevils and maggots are generated between the chain and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the susceptibility to the occurrence is this vein where you find inflammation in the chest; and then the area becomes blistered; and afterwards, the vein starts to emerge from the location of that blistering which resembles a leaf blade.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the extremity appears from him, then it is necessary that you wrap around it a piece of lead whose weight is one drachm within two drachms, and attach that and leave the lead hanging from the bed.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as you need to keep it in place from the outside parts, wrap that with lead and secure it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the wound is prolonged, then you incise a part of it and wrap the remainder; and do not cut that which has been inflamed until it comes out, for if you incise that which is contracted, it enters into the flesh and causes an abscess and putrefaction in the area and a bad ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For it is necessary that it be treated gently and extracted little by little until it is completely removed from the wound, so that no cause for further issues remains in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And in some men, this vein extends to a length of five palms and ten digits, though I have heard of one reaching twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during its treatment, then insert the probe into the channel and perforate that with a long probe through the flesh until all of the matter inside is evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the area for several days using medicines; then treat it according to the treatment for abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has branches, especially when it approaches the joint of the foot or in the foot itself, and it comes out through multiple openings, with a branch extending from each opening.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat it in this way as we have said in the division and with what has been said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the section on worms generated under the skin and it is called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called in some regions the bovine disease because small white spots appear on the buttocks, and it is a worm that lives between the skin and the flesh, traveling throughout the body up and down, and its presence is felt as it moves from one member to another until it breaks through the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, just as worms, serpents, and worms like roundworms andascarids are generated in the stomach.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for its maliciousness, for when it travels through the body and reaches the head, and gets to the eye, then it causes great pain within it and enters, destroying the eye, which results in white spots appearing.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore, when you wish to treat it and extract it, it cannot be done without feeling its movement and appearance. Then you must tightly bind what is above it and below it with strong bandaging and constriction, and then dry it out and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and you do not find it, then place a heated cautery over the area where it lies, and the greatest fear is corruption of the wound, which corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see that it has reached close to the eye, then press strongly over the eyebrow with a tight bandage, and then dry it out, and extract it; and the patient must use purgatives to evacuate bad putrid humors from their body, and they should avoid foods that generate putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Regarding the treatment for nausea.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called nafir in our land, and it is pain that comes to some members, and then changes from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen that second thing which I will recount to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small swelling in the vein of her arm. After remaining there for about an hour, I observed that swelling rise up as if it were wax moving from one place to another, but more lightly than before, as if it were live silver flowing from one place to another.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain moved to that area and settled into the muscle, and remained there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it spreads to the other side of the body until it reaches the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I observed that it moved throughout her entire body as I saw; and I was greatly amazed by the transformation and the speed at which it traveled from one member to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had seen this before in my other patients in the same manner; however, I have seen many cases where the pain is transferred from one limb to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But do not see this with the fingers as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I do not think this is anything other than because of this that the woman was weak, or rather of dry body and exposed veins, and in this condition felt this altered wind.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that this reverse cure does not appear in those who are delicate and have a moist body with engorged veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want the cure of him, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent to you as we have said, then you press on that place lightly and incise into it until that compressed air comes out, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not feel it with your own hands, then treat it with body percussion and by expelling gas, and purge those areas with foul-smelling pills and pills of senna and the like.
De extraccio de sagetas.	On the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to their types, and according to the parts of the body in which they strike, for their diversity is such that some have large points, and small ones, and concave ones, and blunt ones; and there are those with three angles, and among them are those with barbs; and among them are those with crossbars.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and parts in which they strike is in two ways: for the members are either principal vessels, such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, intestines, bladder, and their likes; and thus when it strikes one of these members and signs of death appear to you, which cause I will recount shortly, then it is necessary that you avoid extracting that arrow in those cases where death would occur in the most critical conditions. And when these bad signs do not appear to you, and the arrow is not hidden deep within the member, then you extract that arrow and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of the skull is when an arrow strikes it, pierces the bone, and exits through the cyphus which is above the brain. For you will experience severe headache, blindness, dizziness, heat in the eyes, inflammation and heat of the tongue, spasms, confusion of understanding, vomiting of bile, sudden loss of speech, destruction of voice, and a white, humid substance resembling powder will exit from the wound location, and the appearance of the flesh around it will become moistened.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And when these signs appear to you, then you should abstain from the treatment and extraction of the arrow, unless it is necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	And the signs of the arrow when it hits the heart, so that it is near the left nipple, and you feel that it is fixed in a hard place, not a soft one; and the movement of the arrow resembles the pulse's movement, and black blood flows from the wound, and there is coldness in the extremities, and cold sweat, and fainting; therefore, you know that death will come quickly.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung are spitting of frothy blood from the wound, and the vessels near the neck are inflamed, and the color of the patient changes, and they expire a large spirit, and they seek a draught of fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow strikes the membrane that is in the feet, and the pain is then near the small bones, and there is a great swelling with intense pain and sighing, and not all the muscle parts are affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if you find an arrow in the stomach, then extract it from the infected food that is indigestible.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow is stuck in the abdomen and embedded within it, you should make an incision at the site of the wound, or on the skin, or into the intestine that has been ruptured, and there is no hope for the extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow pierces the bladder and urine is discharged externally, and some process from it causes issues externally, and severe pain occurs in the patient, then you know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	When the other members as well, such as the face, neck, jaw, shoulders, armpits, vertebrae of the back, collarbone, thigh, breast and similar parts of the limbs, are saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not find a vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow. 
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount to you what I have seen of the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand their significance for your treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that in a man, an arrowhead embeds itself in the lacrimal duct of his eye at the root of his nose, and I extracted it from him through the other side, leaving the earwax intact, and he was healed, and no harm came to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And extract another arrow from a Jew who was struck in the eye region of his face, leaving the eyelid more open, and the arrowhead was already embedded and could not be removed except for a small part to which you attach to his shaft, and it was a large sharp arrow of the Turks, with a lion design on it that had no ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And it is beneficial for the patient, and not accidental in his well-being an unfortunate event.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who had been shot in the throat, and it was an Arab arrow, and that is the one with ears; and then I incised around it between two guides, and it was already submerged in his throat; and then I maneuvered it carefully with that, and then I removed it, and the Christian was healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And he extracted another arrow from a man who had been shot in his belly, and thought that he would die because of it; and thus, after thirty days had passed and there was no change regarding him due to any cause related to his condition, he cut into the arrow and engaged with it, and he was healed, and no bad accident happened to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow was embedded in his back, and the wound had healed over it; and after about seven years, the arrow came out from the root of his thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow was embedded in her belly, and the wound had healed over it, and there was no change in her condition because of it, and the woman did not suffer any harm in any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow was embedded in his face, and the wound had healed over it; he broke off the arrow, feeling no pain, and similar cases have been observed.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And he extracted the arrow from the man, who was a leader of the king, with the arrow embedded in the middle of his nose, which had slightly shifted to the right side, and the entire arrow was concealed.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called for the treatment near the site of the arrow wound within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then I found the arrow's wound to be quite narrow; and then I searched for it with a thin probe, but did not feel it; however, he felt a prick near his right ear, and then I suspected that this pricking was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied a poultice with a dressing that has attractive and digestive properties, believing that the area will become inflamed so that the site of the arrow becomes apparent, thus acting upon it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And there was no significant accident in the area where the arrow had reached; and I continued with the dressing on it for many days, and no accidents occurred; and during this time, the wound healed, and the patient recovered from the injury for many days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and reported this to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then I applied a sharp and corrosive medicine to the wound for many days until it opened up, and with a probe, I examined it, and found the tip of the arrow embedded there, which adhered to the bone.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I adjust in the opening of the wound with that sharp medicine until the tip of the arrow becomes visibly apparent to me, and I proceed at my own pace with this for the duration of time between four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then increase the heat and allow it to be such that I can insert the scissors into it, and remain there, and not obey the impulse to withdraw, for I did not cease to subtlety manipulate and ingeniously work on it in various ways of craft, until one day I managed to grasp it with forceps skillfully made, according to how the design of those will be shown at the end of this chapter, until I extracted it; and then I restored that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the nasal cartilage could not be restored, but I restored it and the wound was consolidated, and the patient was healed completely, and there was no need for any further intervention.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extracting some arrows for which you should pause and consider the meaning behind what I have not said, because the parts of this art and the definitions thereof are not understood through mere narration nor are they fully grasped by reading the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise artisans compare a little with much; and what is present with what is absent; and they find new operations and new instruments by tracing back to the foreign causes of the art when such occurrences happen.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not removed from the members in which they are embedded except in two ways: either by attraction of the place where they enter; or by the opposite at the other end.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is expelled from where it entered, or is a discharge coming from a fleshly area, and is thrust out and forcefully expelled.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the timing of when to cut, then it is necessary that you leave it for several days until the flesh around it becomes rotten, and the attraction to it is lessened and its expulsion is eased.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is embedded in bones and does not respond to treatment, then leave that for several days and repeat the process with traction and movement every day, and it will be dislodged.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not respond to treatment for several days, then you must drill around the trajectory of the arrow in that bone from all sides with a fine tool until the area around the arrow is enlarged, and then extract it.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Regarding ventilation and the qualities of using those methods.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Blisters can be made from horns, or from resin, or from veal.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done in two ways: one of them is with scarification and blood extraction, and the other is ventilation without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation that is without scarification is done in two ways, for it can be done with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for the blisters that are administered with scarification and blood extraction, there are fourteen sites on the body. Among these, one location where blisters are placed is alnocrati, which is the back part of the head; another site is on both sides of the neck; blisters under the jaw below the mandible, just below the mouth; blisters on both armpits; blisters on alohoster, which is at the end of the spine; blisters on both flanks, and these are from both arms; blisters on both temples; and blisters on both thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And for bleeding, you do not extract blood from the small veins scattered throughout the flesh, and by this you do not diminish their strength as is often the case with phlebotomy; nor should bleeding be done with fire or without fire in any disease caused by accumulation until the whole body has been evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	And if the necessity for bleeding is provoked by illness or continuously, administer it at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, in the middle of the month, and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that among men, there are those in whom blood multiplies to the point where it needs to be extracted through bleeding; they experience heaviness and swelling in their head. Among them are those who suffer from accumulation and heat in their face, head, and neck. There are also those who feel sharp pain in their face and forehead, along with darkness and dullness in their eyes. Some of these individuals sweat at the site of the bleeding. Others have an increase in phlegm. Some experience a taste of blood in their mouth or have a swollen tongue that spits out blood. There are also those who sleep excessively, and others who see blood in their dreams, along with heat, chills, plagues, and other similar causes.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when dealing with any of those causes, and specifically if it is in the third month or a bit later, then I command that ventilation be performed more than two or three hours after passing.

But the bloodlettings that are performed by incision should be applied to the liver area, and on the spleen and gout-affected areas, and around the navel, at the sites of the joints, and on the spine, because these parts cannot withstand incisions on them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired by those for anything but the attraction of blood from a member, just as placing a cupping glass on the breast in the illness of nasal bleeding; and they use that to dissolve fresh and viscous air trapped within the member, just as when placed on the abdomen and navel; because that rarefies the member, warms it, and removes the pain when you resolve the air.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is already placed on the lungs when you encounter their congestion or phlegm, for by the power of strong attraction it removes congestion and eliminates the phlegm from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly, it acts when placed on the liver and spleen to expel air trapped within those organs.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cupping glasses are applied only with suction; and sometimes they are applied with heat.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are applied filled with tepid water in the diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz. Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cupping administered with fire: the diameter of the opening should be two fingers wide, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of air inside should be half a palm; and it should be placed on his side, in the area that is within the circuit, halfway across it, where the puncture should be small enough for a needle to enter.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of smooth or citrus wood, with thick edges, round, equal, and smooth so that it does not move the limb from its position on it. 
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of the transverse bar of iron or wood, a candle is placed with fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this cupping glass is larger than the one we have recommended; and it should be smaller than that according to the illness and the age of the person using it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cupping glasses for children and those who are weakened are different from the cupping glasses for young adults and those with larger bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The quality of applying this cupping glass with fire on the limb is to extend a strip with fire from decent wood in front of a small candle flame, and place that in the middle of the transverse rod at the center of the cupping glass, so that the fire can be lit around it without burning the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Then it should be placed on the patient's limb, with the finger over the spot we have mentioned, until such time as when we have the cupping glasses and do not want to keep the finger in place for the vapor to rise over that spot, then the cupping glass will soon come off.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	Then ignite the strip according to its manner, and repeat that if you need to do so.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	Here is the translation line by line based on the provided instructions:

Capitol .xcvii.	Capitol .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz. Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the section of the third part: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is often necessary in the art of medicine; it is about the restoration of fractures and dislocations in the bones.

Capitol primier.	First chapter.

Summary and collections concerning bone fractures, from which a preliminary note is necessary before we begin the recollection of fractured members and the various aspects of each one.

E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg. E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre. And therefore as the broken bone begins to heal, then the patient must be fed nutritious foods that are rich and heavy with viscosity, such as foods made from cooked wheat with water, rice, beans, fish, cow's stomachs, eggs, fresh cheese, thick wine, and similar items. With this regimen, fracture healing coagulates more easily and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor. E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are solidified and continued according to their nature at all times by the drying of those members, and thus continue and strengthen those that belong to them at the end of their softness, just as the bones of young children do.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and you should bind over the fractured bone from all sides with something similar to glue in which there is thickness that adheres and strengthens what is between them as they are conglutinated and tied together, until strength and firmness come, just as at the beginning when fire starts, until nothing stops it from its work.

Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	And describe the diversity of fractures according to the diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the bone in the head is different from a fracture of the thigh bone; and a fracture of the foot bone is different from a fracture of the back bone; and similarly all other limbs are diverse among them.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I will include a recollection of every type of fracture, explained in its own separate chapter distinct from the other.

And the types of bone fractures are diversified within themselves; for there is an arched fracture that occurs in the ribs; and sometimes a fracture follows the length of the bone: and these are the fractures of the spine, ribs, and procedural and non-procedural additions, just as it is done with a pen when it is prepared to write, and there is a fracture with a plate and disruption at the head, and there is a small fissure fracture.

Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Mark the sign of a bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma. E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration and healing of soft tissues is quicker than that of bone where the injury has occurred.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Then strengthen that second part so that the memory of it returns.

And then attach, and equalize and conduct a proper operation and constriction of that limb, and rest and tranquility; advise the patient about this and make them abstain from any distress to that limb during their waking hours and sleep, and observe its movement and agitation, and prevent all its movements with all its strength; and wait until the position of the limb is such a position in which pain is assured, which happens when it is in the disposition of the painful or injured position; then you must change it to another position where no pain is felt; and take care that the position of the limb is straight and equal so that when restored, no deformity occurs to the limb.

E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.
